article:
An old farmer lived on a farm in the mountains with his young grandson. Each morning Grandpa was up early sitting at the kitchen table   _  his book. His grandson wanted to be just like him and tried to  _  him in every way he could.
One day the grandson asked, "Grandpa! I try to read that book just like you do,   _  I don't understand it, and what I do understand I  _  as soon as I close the book.   What  good  does reading the book do?"
The grandfather quietly turned from putting coal in the stove and replied, "Take this coal basket down to the river and bring me back a basket of   _     ."
The boy did as he was told, but all the water    leaked out  before
he got back to the house.
The grandfather laughed and said, "You'll have to move a little more   _  next time." Then he sent the boy back to the river with the
basket to try  _     .This time the boy ran faster,
but again the basket was  _  before he
returned home.
  Out of breath   , he told his grandfather that it was   _  to
carry water in a basket, and he went to get a bucket  _  .
The old man said, "I don't want a    _  of water; I want a basket
of water. You're just not trying hard enough."  This time  he went out of the
door to watch the boy try again.
The boy again dipped the basket into the river and ran as hard as he could, but when he  _  his grandfather the basket was again empty. Out of
breath, he said, "See, Grandpa, it's useless!"
"So you think it is useless?" the old man said, "Look at the basket."
The boy looked at the basket and for the first time realized that the basket was   _  .
Instead of a dirty old coal basket, it was  _  ,
inside and out.
"Son, that's what   _  when you read the book. You might not understand or remember
everything, but when you read it, you will be  _  ,
inside and out."
